result.execSummary:
The defendant Pamela R. Wienke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Fraudulent Use (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(5)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $705 (incl. DNA surcharge) + Court appointed Attorney fees; to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 5/21/15 and on the 21st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 14  day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, can be served in another county jail so long as it is at no expense to Jefferson Co.
05-06-2015 The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $367.50

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Pamela R. Wienke

Reminder Notice--Final Notice
To Defendant from Bookkeeping regarding Attorney Fees.
The Court orders the defendant to reimburse Jefferson County for court appointed attorney fees in the amount of $367.50
Petition  payment of attorney fees
Reminder of payment extension
With elements and criminal case settlement agreement forms attached.

Case called at 10:19am [mo]
Defendant Pamela R. Wienke in court with Attorney Teri M. Strohschein.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.
Atty. Stroschein indicates that the Defense is prepared to proceed with Plea and Sentencing today.
ADA Hall indicates no victim impact statement has been submitted nor is anyone present in the gallery.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "No Contest" entered; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Strohschein
Statement made by Ms. Wienke


The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $200 + costs = $705 (incl. DNA surcharge) + Court appointed Attorney fees; to be paid in $50 per month installments commencing on 5/21/15 and on the 21st day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 14  day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive, can be served in another county jail so long as it is at no expense to Jefferson Co.

recess: 10:35am--reconvene 10:37am
The Court has now learned that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute a case in which Ms. Wienke was a victim. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed.
recess: 10:40am
Order appointing counsel endorsed by Attorney Strohschein
Status conference on April 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 8, 2015 at 01:20 pm.
Scheduling Notice

recess 2:19pm.

Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

case called at 2:42pm. [MK]
Defendant Pamela R. Wienke in court. DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint. 
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given
After Ms. Wienke indicates that she wishes to be represented by counsel, the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance. 

The Court requires $1.000  signature bond, with conditions: 
--no presence at the BP Station in Lake Mills
--Ms. Wienke is not to use any financial cards not in her name
--to go to the Public Defenders Office in Jefferson today to apply for representation or schedule an appointment to apply for representation
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess 2:48pm. 


NEXT:  Adjourned Initial Appearance on 3/17/15 at 2:00pm.
